creatures.Name: Kalshazzak
creatures.Description: A squat, misshapen demon also known as 'Toadface', with leathery, warty features and immense strength.
creatures.Weakness: Holy items and expressions of genuine faith. Mediocre initiative.
creatures.Powers: Acid Breath (Prouesse): Spits Weapon:2 acid once per scene. Claw Barrage (Prouesse): +2 damage in melee. Supernatural Strength and Toughness.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 9; Speed: 5 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Summoned by Victor Sells and later turned on his creator. A classic short-range powerhouse.

creatures.Name: Chaunzaggoroth
creatures.Description: Also known as 'Chauncy', a chitinous demon with crab-like pincers and beak-like nose, acting as a broker of information.
creatures.Weakness: Holy items and faith. Tends to overplay his subtlety.
creatures.Powers: Infernal Bargain (Prouesse): +2 to Contacts for forbidden knowledge. Great initiative, Inhuman Strength, Speed, Toughness. Weapon:4 claws.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 8; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Appears in summoning circles to make infernal deals. Rarely engages in direct combat.

Description.text: Purple, winged monkey-like demons that act in packs and combine into larger, stronger forms.

Weakness.text: Demonic weaknesses; individual forms are fragile.

Powers.text: Combining Form (Prouesse): May merge for +2 stats. Incendiary Breath Weapon (poo), Wings, scalable strength and toughness.

Stats.text: Health: 6 (Chimp) to 14 (Kong); Attack: 6–10; Defense: 5–9; Speed: Variable (4–8 of Spades)

Background.text: Used by the Temple Dog kidnappers; escalate threat by recombining forms.

creatures.Name: Possessed People
creatures.Description: People under demonic or ghostly possession, often enhanced in speed and strength.
creatures.Weakness: Same as demons, plus the host’s vulnerabilities.
creatures.Powers: Demonic Enhancement (Prouesse): Adds +2 to Athletics or Fists. Can bypass thresholds and resist magic.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 8; Defense: 6; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Examples include Lydia from 'Grave Peril'. Often underestimated due to human appearance.

creatures.Name: Angel
creatures.Description: Beings of pure soul-stuff. Rarely intervene directly but are powerful when they do.
creatures.Weakness: Heavily constrained by divine laws; operate subtly or not at all.
creatures.Powers: Soulfire Smite (Prouesse): Once per day, inflict divine damage +3. May create protective wards.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 9; Defense: 10; Speed: Ace of Spades
creatures.Background: Infrequently appear; sometimes send messages or act indirectly through agents.

creatures.Name: Goblin
creatures.Description: Savage hunters of the Faerie wilds. Strong instincts, good team coordination, and fearsome in packs.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron and standard fae limitations including truth-bound speech and poor tolerance for pain.
creatures.Powers: Pack Instincts (Prouesse): +1 Attack per ally adjacent; Echoes of the Beast (hunting hound), Inhuman Toughness and Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 7; Defense: 6; Speed: 9 of Spades
creatures.Background: Often deployed as scouts or ambushers. Effective both at range and in melee.

creatures.Name: Elder Gruff
creatures.Description: A goat-like knight of immense stature and power. Wields a sword as long as a car.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron; noble and predictable due to code of honor.
creatures.Powers: Heroic Charge (Prouesse): Once per fight, gains +2 to melee and knocks prone; Inhuman and Supernatural Strength/Toughness.
creatures.Stats: Health: 14; Attack: 12; Defense: 10; Speed: 8 of Spades
creatures.Background: Eldest warrior among the Gruffs. Embodies fae nobility and unstoppable melee force.

creatures.Name: Nixie
creatures.Description: Dangerous faerie temptress from lakes and rivers. Drowns mortals for pleasure.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron, glamours can be resisted by strong will.
creatures.Powers: Water Seduction (Prouesse): Once per encounter, charm target near water; Aquatic, Glamours, Incite Emotion.
creatures.Stats: Health: 6; Attack: 6; Defense: 5; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Drawn to coastal cities and mortal parties. Known to impersonate lost loved ones.

creatures.Name: Sidhe
creatures.Description: Noble fae who often appear as hauntingly beautiful humanoids. They possess powerful magic and political influence.
creatures.Weakness: Standard fae weaknesses and additional ones depending on their Court and type.
creatures.Powers: Court Magic (Prouesse): Access to Seelie or Unseelie magic. Greater Glamours, Inhuman Strength/Speed/Toughness, Countermagic.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 9; Speed: King of Spades
creatures.Background: The highest ranking fae, Sidhe serve the Faerie Queens and hold sway over the Courts' affairs.

Description.text: Mortals empowered by Faerie Queens to act as their champions. Embody both fae magic and human free will.

Weakness.text: Bound to the Court's service and commands. May suffer if disobeying Faerie law.

Powers.text: Knight’s Mantle (Prouesse): Grants Inhuman traits, Court Magic, combat skills. May have an Item of Power or Greater Glamours.

Stats.text: Health: 10–12; Attack: 9–11; Defense: 9; Speed: Queen of Spades

Background.text: Fix (Summer) and Lloyd Slate (Winter) are the best-known examples. Their duties are vital to Faerie balance.

Description.text: Huge, hideous fae brutes with regenerating bodies and a tendency to dissolve into mini-trolls upon defeat.

Weakness.text: Cold iron and similar weaknesses. Fearful of fire.

Powers.text: Bridge Guardian (Prouesse): Weapon:6 claws, Hulking Size, Supernatural Strength and Recovery.

Stats.text: Health: 16; Attack: 11; Defense: 8; Speed: 5 of Clubs

Background.text: Live under bridges; ancient enforcers of the Unseelie Accords. Stronghold guards for Queen Mab.

Description.text: Vicious air fae resembling winged girls with razor-sharp features and claws.

Weakness.text: Cold iron, bright light, and normal fae vulnerabilities.

Powers.text: Strafe Attack (Prouesse): +1 attack in flight; Weapon:2 claws, Wings, Inhuman Speed, Inhuman Recovery.

Stats.text: Health: 6; Attack: 7; Defense: 8; Speed: Queen of Spades

Background.text: Seen in the War Over Chicago. Known for their lightning-quick dives and brutal swarming tactics.

Description.text: Crab-like creatures with massive pincers, known for acting alongside nixies.

Powers.text: Vise Grip (Prouesse): +2 to grappling Might rolls. Supernatural Toughness, Aquatic, Claws.

Stats.text: Health: 10; Attack: 8; Defense: 8; Speed: 6 of Clubs

Background.text: Used in group ambushes and coastal fae encounters. Jenny Greenteeth commands them in war.

creatures.Name: Spectre
creatures.Description: Translucent, glowing semi-corporeal undead constructs created through necromancy.
creatures.Weakness: Ghost Dust and disruptions to ectoplasmic form; can be affected by anyone once manifested.
creatures.Powers: Spectral Soldier (Prouesse): Weapon:2 from ectoplasmic claws; Inhuman Strength and Recovery.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 8; Defense: 8; Speed: 7 of Spades
creatures.Background: Created and used by necromancers as shock troops. Limited autonomy.

creatures.Name: University of Chicago Library Ghost
creatures.Description: A powerful ghost anchored to a specific academic site, manifesting with violent kinetic energy.
creatures.Weakness: Can only be harmed by acknowledged individuals or in the Nevernever.
creatures.Powers: Poltergeist Burst (Prouesse): Violent telekinesis, Armor:2 in spirit form, Physical Immunity under conditions.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 7; Defense: 9; Speed: 6 of Spades
creatures.Background: A prime example of haunting-based defense around knowledge and study.

Description.text: Humans possessed by Fallen angels bound to silver coins. Appear mostly human, but transform into monstrous forms.

Weakness.text: Bound to their coin, vulnerable to faith, churches, and spiritual weaponry like the Swords of the Cross.

Powers.text: Denarian Bond (Prouesse): Access to Hellfire, shapeshifting, centuries of magical knowledge; combine mortal skill with demonic power.

Stats.text: Health: 14; Attack: 12; Defense: 10; Speed: King of Spades

Background.text: Thirty exist; some serve Nicodemus or Tessa. Deadly foes of the Knights of the Cross.

creatures.Name: Rawhead & Bloody Bones
creatures.Description: A muscular skeleton demon of bones and dried blood, with a bull skull for a head and claws.
creatures.Weakness: Standard fae vulnerabilities; vulnerable to heavy iron weapons.
creatures.Powers: Bone Fist (Prouesse): Weapon:3 claw damage; Supernatural Strength and Physical Recovery.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 9; Defense: 7; Speed: 6 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Urban legends brought to life, grows in power the more it feeds. Common boogeyman in Appalachian folklore.

creatures.Name: Sue the Zombie Dinosaur
creatures.Description: A reanimated Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton powered by necromantic might.
creatures.Weakness: Mystical catch (undisclosed); otherwise almost invincible.
creatures.Powers: Dino Charge (Prouesse): Weapon:8 bite and stomp. Mythic Strength and Toughness, Living Dead.
creatures.Stats: Health: 24; Attack: 14; Defense: 12; Speed: 5 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Brought to life in a Darkhallow; became a moment of legend during magical war.

Description.text: A monstrous ghoul with exaggerated features and immense physical power.

Weakness.text: Likely vulnerable to holy objects and massive trauma, but exact limitations unknown.

Powers.text: Brute Horror (Prouesse): Weapon:6 claws; Mythic Recovery; Supernatural Strength; Inhuman Toughness and Speed.

Stats.text: Health: 18; Attack: 12; Defense: 11; Speed: King of Clubs

Background.text: Rare elite ghoul variant, possibly ancient or crossbred. Terrifying in combat, nearly unkillable.

creatures.Name: Hecatean Hag
creatures.Description: Tall, withered women with claws, armored skin, and mastery of magic and poison.
creatures.Weakness: Lose their supernatural toughness once wounded. Vulnerable to flame, divine symbols.
creatures.Powers: Lightning Surge & Fire Blast (Prouesse): Weapon:5 and Weapon:3 spells; Supernatural Toughness, Poison Claws, Venom Aspect.
creatures.Stats: Health: 14; Attack: 10; Defense: 9; Speed: 7 of Spades
creatures.Background: Once human witches who transformed into monstrous killers. Come in groups, devastating spellcasters.

creatures.Name: Knight of the Cross
creatures.Description: A bearer of one of the three Holy Swords, empowered by faith to combat evil.
creatures.Weakness: Cannot use powers for selfish or unjust acts. Harm to innocents disrupts their power.
creatures.Powers: Holy Strike (Prouesse): Weapon:4 vs evil; True Faith, Angelic Aid, Morality Sense, Soulfire Ward.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 9; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Chosen mortals wielding relics like Amoracchius. Stand against darkness, especially Denarians.

creatures.Name: Temple Dog
creatures.Description: Sacred canines bred to guard monks and holy places. Intelligent and spiritually aware.
creatures.Weakness: Mystical abilities exhaust them. Vulnerable after prolonged use of sacred powers.
creatures.Powers: Sacred Bark (Prouesse): Zone-wide supernatural ward. Inhuman Recovery, Supernatural Sense.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 8; Defense: 8; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Descended from Foo Dogs and used by Eastern monasteries to defend against dark spirits.

creatures.Name: Half-Demon
creatures.Description: The offspring of a demon and a human. Blends terrifying potential with mortal unpredictability.
creatures.Weakness: Unknown, possibly dependent on demonic heritage. Sometimes arrogant or morally indifferent.
creatures.Powers: Infernal Legacy (Prouesse): Enhanced stats and demonic features. Inhuman Speed, Supernatural Sense.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 9; Speed: King of Spades
creatures.Background: Individuals like Kincaid and Drakul hint at frightening power within mortal limits.

creatures.Name: Foo Dog
creatures.Description: Celestial guardian spirit resembling a lion or mastiff, often used as temple protectors.
creatures.Weakness: Rarely found in the modern world. May expend themselves using sacred powers.
creatures.Powers: Spirit Ward (Prouesse): Supernatural Sense, Supernatural Strength, Toughness, Bark-Based Aura.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 9; Defense: 9; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Ancestor of the Temple Dogs. Revered in Asian temples. Rarely appears directly.

creatures.Name: Grendelkin
creatures.Description: Hulking beastmen descended from the mythic Grendel. Massive, cunning, and nearly unkillable.
creatures.Weakness: Vulnerable to non-mortal weapons like enchanted axes or other supernatural claws.
creatures.Powers: Shadow Cloak (Prouesse): Gains +2 defense in darkness. Mythic Recovery, Physical Immunity (limited), Inhuman Speed/Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 16; Attack: 11; Defense: 10; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Linked to old Anglo-Saxon myths. Represent ultimate muscle for powerful patrons.

creatures.Name: Jann
creatures.Description: Scion of a djinn and a mortal. Human-like in appearance but unnaturally fast and vicious.
creatures.Weakness: Unknown; vulnerable to magical suppression or banishment spells.
creatures.Powers: Smokeless Fire (Prouesse): Fire aura, Inhuman Speed, Supernatural Sense, Claws (bite).
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 8; Defense: 7; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Rare and dangerous, often used as elite agents for elemental forces.

creatures.Name: Concept Spirit
creatures.Description: Spiritual manifestations of abstract concepts like Rage, Hunger, or Reason.
creatures.Weakness: Bound to their concept; struggle outside their domain. Faith-based barriers work well.
creatures.Powers: Incarnate Essence (Prouesse): Varies by concept (Rage = Strength, Hunger = Speed, etc.). May possess hosts.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: Variable; Defense: Variable; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Often summoned by mages or sponsoring powerful supernatural entities.

creatures.Name: Black Dog
creatures.Description: Hellish spectral hound resembling a mastiff, often seen before attacks or deaths.
creatures.Weakness: None explicitly known. May dissolve when exposed to extreme light or consecrated areas.
creatures.Powers: Death Harbinger (Prouesse): May cause fear, Inhuman Strength/Speed, Goo Reconstitution.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 7; Speed: 9 of Spades
creatures.Background: Rumored to be able to pass through mirrors. Stalkers of the cursed.

creatures.Name: Master Black Court Vampire
creatures.Description: An ancient, decayed vampire possessing both physical monstrosity and dark magical ability.
creatures.Weakness: Sunlight, garlic, fire, sacred items, running water, stake to the heart, no shadow or reflection.
creatures.Powers: Vampiric Lord (Prouesse): Spawns minions, mist form, Weapon:6 claws, Spellcasting, Mental Domination.
creatures.Stats: Health: 20; Attack: 13; Defense: 11; Speed: Queen of Clubs
creatures.Background: Few remain due to Dracula’s book. Mavra is a notable survivor.

creatures.Name: Red Court Vampire
creatures.Description: A bat-like creature hidden beneath an ectoplasmic skin resembling a seductive human form.
creatures.Weakness: Sunlight, exposed belly, divine symbols. Strong but fragile without disguise.
creatures.Powers: Seductive Predator (Prouesse): Flesh Mask, Weapon:4 claws, Inhuman traits, Narcotic Saliva.
creatures.Stats: Health: 14; Attack: 11; Defense: 10; Speed: King of Spades
creatures.Background: Feed on blood. Responsible for the deaths of many supernatural and mortal beings alike.

creatures.Name: White Court Vampire
creatures.Description: Emotion-feeding predators with alluring appearance and symbiotic demons called Hungers.
creatures.Weakness: True emotions (love, hope, courage) associated with opposing their preferred feed emotion.
creatures.Powers: Emotional Vampire (Prouesse): Incite Emotion, Inhuman traits, Kiss of Death for old vampires.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 10; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Divided into Houses: Raith (lust), Malvora (fear), Skavis (despair). Thomas is a known member.

creatures.Name: Renfield
creatures.Description: A human whose mind has been shattered by a Black Court vampire’s domination.
creatures.Weakness: Poor awareness; easily manipulated. Not protected by the Laws of Magic—but ethically murky.
creatures.Powers: Violent Puppet (Prouesse): Inhuman Strength, Inhuman Recovery, fanatical loyalty.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 6; Speed: 7 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Named after Dracula’s servant. Can be created through psychic torture.

creatures.Name: Darkhound
creatures.Description: Fleshless, undead dog imbued with Black Court power. Mindless rage incarnate.
creatures.Weakness: Same as Black Court vampires, but animalistic intelligence limits cunning.
creatures.Powers: Death Hound (Prouesse): Weapon:3 bite, Fanatic Endurance, Inhuman Speed & Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 7; Speed: 10 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Used as trackers and shock troops for undead forces.

creatures.Name: Classic Werewolf
creatures.Description: A mortal who uses magic to transform into a wolf; the mind remains human, but the form is fully lupine.
creatures.Weakness: No innate supernatural defenses; must learn to operate in wolf form.
creatures.Powers: Beast Change, Inhuman Speed, Inhuman Strength, Pack Instincts.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 8; Defense: 8; Speed: 9 of Spades
creatures.Background: A disciplined and secretive form of therianthropy. Vulnerable while adapting to new instincts.

creatures.Name: Hexenwolf
creatures.Description: Human with a magical talisman enabling transformation into a savage, deadly wolf.
creatures.Weakness: Power tied to belt; uncontrollable violent urges. Removing talisman reverts form.
creatures.Powers: Beast Change, Supernatural Strength, Speed, Recovery; Item of Power; Demonic Co-Pilot.
creatures.Stats: Health: 14; Attack: 12; Defense: 10; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Creates a rift between conscious control and primal rage. Dangerous and unstable.

creatures.Name: Loup-Garou
creatures.Description: An involuntary werewolf cursed to transform during the full moon into a nigh-unkillable beast.
creatures.Weakness: Only harmed by inherited silver; uncontrollable during transformations.
creatures.Powers: Physical Immunity, Supernatural Recovery, Hulking Size, Supernatural Strength/Speed, Weapon:6 claws.
creatures.Stats: Health: 24; Attack: 14; Defense: 12; Speed: King of Spades
creatures.Background: Ravaged Gevaudan and Chicago. Considered one of the deadliest creatures in the Dresdenverse.

creatures.Name: Lycanthrope
creatures.Description: A human conduit for a spirit of Rage. No transformation, just massive physical and mental boost.
creatures.Weakness: Lunar dependency; vulnerable when the moon isn't present.
creatures.Powers: Inhuman Strength, Inhuman Recovery, Echoes of the Beast, Pack Instincts.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 8; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Drawn from Norse myth. Rare and dangerous, particularly when in a frenzy.

creatures.Name: Wolfwere
creatures.Description: A wolf that has learned magic to transform into a human. Retains animal instincts and traits.
creatures.Weakness: Struggles with human culture, language, and tech. Distractible and alien in mindset.
creatures.Powers: Thumbs! Inhuman Speed, Supernatural Sense, Good Physicality in Human Form.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 7; Defense: 7; Speed: 9 of Spades
creatures.Background: Rarest of shapeshifters. Tera West is the most notable example.

creatures.Name: Zombie
creatures.Description: Reanimated corpse powered by necromantic magic. Tough, mindless, and obedient.
creatures.Weakness: Massive trauma, running water, magic circles, or salt can disrupt animation.
creatures.Powers: Inhuman Strength, Inhuman Speed, Inhuman Toughness, Living Dead.
creatures.Stats: Health: 11; Attack: 9; Defense: 8; Speed: 8 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Used by necromancers through drum-linked commands. Smart as a dog, strong as a beast.

creatures.Name: White Council Wizard
creatures.Description: Licensed full wizard recognized by the White Council. Trained in evocation, thaumaturgy, and the Laws of Magic.
creatures.Weakness: Bound by the Laws of Magic. Can be executed for violations. Long casting times and component requirements.
creatures.Powers: Evocation/Thaumaturgy (Prouesse): +2 on ritual-based spellcasting; Wizard’s Constitution; Sponsored Magic; Lore: Superb.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 8; Defense: 8; Speed: 7 of Spades
creatures.Background: The central authority for mortal magic in the Dresdenverse. Includes major players like Harry Dresden and Ebenezar McCoy.

creatures.Name: Warden of the White Council
creatures.Description: Armed enforcers of the White Council. Investigate black magic and execute rogue wizards.
creatures.Weakness: Highly political and feared. Held to strict rules and procedures. Not immune to Council politics.
creatures.Powers: Warden’s Blade (Prouesse): +2 damage vs lawbreakers. Wizard’s Constitution; Combat Magic; Inhuman Recovery.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 9; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Trained to fight magical threats. Carry enchanted swords capable of bypassing magical defenses.

creatures.Name: Black Council Agent
creatures.Description: Rogue wizards, manipulators, or monsters working toward some grand apocalyptic conspiracy.
creatures.Weakness: Often arrogant or overconfident. Act independently, lack formal structure.
creatures.Powers: Dark Sorcery (Prouesse): Weaponized rituals, curses, mind control; often Sponsored Magic.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 9; Defense: 8; Speed: 8 of Spades
creatures.Background: A hidden force manipulating supernatural events behind the scenes. Identity of leaders unknown.

creatures.Name: Cultist
creatures.Description: Fanatical followers of dark powers—Old Ones, demons, or fallen angels. Often dabble in blood rituals.
creatures.Weakness: Often unstable or misinformed. Can be manipulated by their supposed 'gods'.
creatures.Powers: Fanatical Zeal (Prouesse): Gain +1 to ritual magic and social intimidation when in a group.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 6; Defense: 5; Speed: 6 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Occasionally empowered by the beings they worship. Most are disposable pawns.

creatures.Name: Hedge Wizard
creatures.Description: A dabbler in magic without formal training. Capable of small rituals or basic combat spells.
creatures.Weakness: Lack of discipline. May be unaware of magical law or backlash.
creatures.Powers: Jury-Rigged Magic (Prouesse): Once per day create a spell effect with +2, but risky.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 6; Defense: 5; Speed: 6 of Spades
creatures.Background: Unregistered and sometimes dangerous. Not all are hostile—some just want to help.

creatures.Name: Necromancer
creatures.Description: Master of death magic. Animates corpses, binds ghosts, and violates natural laws.
creatures.Weakness: Subject to the death penalty under the Laws of Magic. Soul erosion from use.
creatures.Powers: Animate Dead (Prouesse): Raise 1–3 zombies per turn. Ghost control. Thaumaturgy master.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 7; Speed: 6 of Spades
creatures.Background: Illegal wizards like Corpsetaker and Cowl exemplify necromantic extremes.

creatures.Name: Disciple of Kemmler
creatures.Description: Follower of the infamous Kemmler. Possesses rituals for mass resurrection, ghost binding, and soul theft.
creatures.Weakness: Insatiable hunger for power. Frequent clashes with other necromancers or law enforcement.
creatures.Powers: Dark Resurrection (Prouesse): May animate entire cemeteries. Mythic Lore and Rituals.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 11; Defense: 9; Speed: Queen of Clubs
creatures.Background: Kemmler’s teachings were banned due to their sheer potency. Only a few disciples remain.

creatures.Name: Sorcerer
creatures.Description: Powerful but undisciplined spellcaster, usually not recognized by the White Council.
creatures.Weakness: Magic is instinctual, not trained. May suffer mental or magical backlash.
creatures.Powers: Raw Talent (Prouesse): Can cast spells without focus but with +1 penalty to control rolls.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 8; Defense: 7; Speed: 7 of Spades
creatures.Background: May have learned through trauma, bloodline, or experimentation. Can become major threats.

creatures.Name: Sponsored Magic User
creatures.Description: Magician granted supernatural powers by a patron such as a fae, demon, or elemental force.
creatures.Weakness: Patron’s agenda shapes available magic. Breaking pact may have consequences.
creatures.Powers: Sponsored Magic (Prouesse): +2 to spells within the patron’s domain. Often includes additional perks.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 9; Defense: 8; Speed: 8 of Spades
creatures.Background: Examples include Winter Knight, Namshiel’s host, and Knights of the Blackened Denarius.

creatures.Name: Special Investigations
creatures.Description: A special unit of the Chicago Police Department led by Karrin Murphy, tasked with investigating supernatural incidents.
creatures.Weakness: Lacks official support and budget. Often ridiculed by conventional departments.
creatures.Powers: Street-Smart Tactics (Prouesse): +2 to Investigation or Tactics rolls when facing supernatural threats.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 7; Defense: 7; Speed: 7 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Though underfunded and overworked, S.I. is the mortal frontline against supernatural crimes.

creatures.Name: Venatori Umbrum
creatures.Description: An ancient organization dedicated to studying and combating supernatural threats using research and relics.
creatures.Weakness: Non-magical. Relies on ancient texts, artifacts, and indirect influence.
creatures.Powers: Arcane Lore (Prouesse): +2 to Occult Knowledge checks. Occasionally possess enchanted gear.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 6; Defense: 7; Speed: 6 of Spades
creatures.Background: Comprised of scholars, spies, and collectors. Often allies to independent practitioners.

creatures.Name: Made Man
creatures.Description: An enforcer or capo in a supernatural-aware mafia. Often serve supernatural powers for profit or protection.
creatures.Weakness: Bound to mortal laws and physical limits. Vulnerable to blackmail or betrayal.
creatures.Powers: Loyal Crew (Prouesse): +2 to Intimidation or Coercion when backed by a gang.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 7; Defense: 6; Speed: 6 of Clubs
creatures.Background: John Marcone's men are examples of ruthless efficiency and ambition in the mortal world.

creatures.Name: Dreamer
creatures.Description: Humans whose imaginations are powerful enough to create personal realms in the Nevernever.
creatures.Weakness: Psychologically fragile. Powers mostly limited to dreams and astral projections.
creatures.Powers: Lucid Creation (Prouesse): May shape small dreamscapes or influence Nevernever realms.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 5; Defense: 6; Speed: 6 of Hearts
creatures.Background: Dreamers are rare and often unknowingly influence faerie courts or Outsider incursions.

creatures.Name: Occult Journalist
creatures.Description: Curious writers or bloggers chasing after supernatural truths. May know more than they let on.
creatures.Weakness: Often out of their depth. Can attract unwanted attention.
creatures.Powers: Expose the Hidden (Prouesse): +2 to Investigate and Contact rolls in supernatural circles.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 4; Defense: 5; Speed: 6 of Diamonds
creatures.Background: Some are exploited by darker powers. Others become valuable allies or victims.

creatures.Name: Occult Proprietor
creatures.Description: Operators of arcane bookstores, curiosity shops, or apothecaries. May hoard real magical items.
creatures.Weakness: Not fighters. At risk from magical backlash or theft.
creatures.Powers: Hidden Stockpile (Prouesse): Can provide a rare magical item once per session.
creatures.Stats: Health: 6; Attack: 4; Defense: 5; Speed: 5 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Trusted or shady, these NPCs often act as quest givers or magical suppliers.

creatures.Name: Academic
creatures.Description: University-level scholar specializing in history, folklore, or parazoology.
creatures.Weakness: Not usually aware of the supernatural. Vulnerable to manipulation.
creatures.Powers: Theory into Practice (Prouesse): +2 to Lore rolls and research in historical topics.
creatures.Stats: Health: 6; Attack: 4; Defense: 5; Speed: 6 of Diamonds
creatures.Background: Might unknowingly hold key insights into ancient artifacts or curses.

creatures.Name: EMT
creatures.Description: Paramedics who serve as first responders to violence, often unknowingly involved in supernatural cleanups.
creatures.Weakness: No combat training. Vulnerable to shock, memory gaps, or being targeted.
creatures.Powers: Stabilize the Wounded (Prouesse): May prevent death or reduce injuries in allies.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 4; Defense: 5; Speed: 6 of Hearts
creatures.Background: Sometimes recruited by supernatural beings. Unsung heroes in many cases.

creatures.Name: Forensics Technician
creatures.Description: Scientific personnel trained in identifying unusual crime scene evidence and magical residue.
creatures.Weakness: Scientific disbelief. May rationalize obvious supernatural clues.
creatures.Powers: Trace Magic (Prouesse): +2 to Science or Investigation rolls involving magic-infused items.
creatures.Stats: Health: 6; Attack: 4; Defense: 6; Speed: 6 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Sometimes connects patterns across magical crimes, often before wizards do.

creatures.Name: The Authorities
creatures.Description: Standard law enforcement units, usually unaware of the supernatural world or actively deny it.
creatures.Weakness: Totally outclassed against real supernatural threats.
creatures.Powers: Backup on Call (Prouesse): May summon reinforcements. Standard firearms and arrest procedures.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 6; Defense: 6; Speed: 6 of Spades
creatures.Background: Often manipulated, framed, or bypassed by supernatural factions.

creatures.Name: The Government
creatures.Description: Agencies like the FBI, Homeland Security, or DARPA that may interface with supernatural incidents covertly.
creatures.Weakness: Politically compromised. Often unaware of magical rules or alliances.
creatures.Powers: Deep State Tools (Prouesse): Access to advanced surveillance, classified databases, and legal cover.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 7; Defense: 7; Speed: 7 of Spades
creatures.Background: Some agents become awakened to the supernatural and form shadow groups.

creatures.Name: The Eye of Thoth
creatures.Description: An order of enlightened scholars focused on maintaining knowledge and guarding sacred truths.
creatures.Weakness: Neutral in politics. Sometimes hindered by their own non-interference doctrines.
creatures.Powers: Protect the Lore (Prouesse): +2 to detect falsehoods or protect sacred knowledge; Artifact access.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 6; Defense: 7; Speed: 6 of Spades
creatures.Background: May act in tandem with Venatori Umbrum or aligned clergy.

creatures.Name: Himalayan Temple Monk
creatures.Description: Trained in deep spiritual disciplines. May use chi-like magic to manipulate spiritual forces.
creatures.Weakness: Strict self-control limits emotional or violent outbursts.
creatures.Powers: Balance Flow (Prouesse): +2 to warding, focus, or calm-based defense. True Faith.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 6; Defense: 8; Speed: 6 of Hearts
creatures.Background: Might serve as healers, watchers, or secret protectors of sacred relics.

creatures.Name: Indian Monastery Ascetic
creatures.Description: Spiritual monks who embrace cosmic harmony and may manipulate supernatural forces via mantras.
creatures.Weakness: May reject violence. Magic is subtle and rarely aggressive.
creatures.Powers: Sanskrit Warding (Prouesse): +2 to ritual protection or soul shielding.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 5; Defense: 7; Speed: 5 of Hearts
creatures.Background: Associated with divine neutrality and protection of innocent souls.

creatures.Name: He Who Walks Behind
creatures.Description: An unknowable, malevolent Outsider entity summoned by powerful warlocks to eliminate targets.
creatures.Weakness: Banishable by powerful magic circles. Loopholes in summoning can be exploited.
creatures.Powers: Erase from Existence (Prouesse): Ignores defenses, targets essence. Physical Immunity.
creatures.Stats: Health: 20; Attack: 15; Defense: 14; Speed: Ace of Spades
creatures.Background: Summoned to pursue Harry Dresden; known for annihilating enemies outside natural law.

creatures.Name: Tentacled Horror
creatures.Description: An aberrant being with squirming limbs and impossible angles. Causes madness by its mere presence.
creatures.Weakness: Strong magical wards. Vulnerable to true names.
creatures.Powers: Sanity Fracture (Prouesse): Fear or confusion as an aura. Tentacle Strike Weapon:5.
creatures.Stats: Health: 16; Attack: 12; Defense: 10; Speed: 7 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Often emerges through rifts from Outside. Usually preceded by cultist activity.

creatures.Name: Rough Thrall
creatures.Description: A human enslaved through demonic contracts or black magic, often with boosted strength but no subtlety.
creatures.Weakness: No autonomy. Easily broken or commanded.
creatures.Powers: Brute Channeling (Prouesse): +2 attack while obeying orders. Inhuman Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 9; Attack: 8; Defense: 6; Speed: 6 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Typically used by dark sorcerers or Denarians as muscle.

creatures.Name: Fine Thrall
creatures.Description: Well-groomed, high-functioning pawn of a supernatural master. Subtle and dangerous.
creatures.Weakness: Loss of master's support disrupts abilities and composure.
creatures.Powers: False Grace (Prouesse): +2 Deceive, may resist mortal detection. Minor magic or supernatural talent.
creatures.Stats: Health: 8; Attack: 6; Defense: 7; Speed: 6 of Diamonds
creatures.Background: Used in infiltration, politics, or even diplomacy under enchantment.

creatures.Name: Valkyrie
creatures.Description: Chosen of Norse gods. Possesses enhanced strength and skill; guides the dead to the afterlife.
creatures.Weakness: Code-bound. Cannot defy the orders of divine hosts.
creatures.Powers: Warrior’s Radiance (Prouesse): Weapon:4 spear; Supernatural Strength; Mythic Endurance.
creatures.Stats: Health: 14; Attack: 12; Defense: 11; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Sigrun is one example seen in the Dresden Files. Serve in mortal wars for divine cause.

creatures.Name: Pixie
creatures.Description: Tiny faerie with a mischievous personality and a craving for pizza. Used often as scouts or spies.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron, distractions (especially food), easily swatted.
creatures.Powers: Miniature Mayhem (Prouesse): +2 to stealth or distraction. Glamours, Inhuman Speed, Wings.
creatures.Stats: Health: 3; Attack: 4; Defense: 5; Speed: 9 of Spades
creatures.Background: Toot-Toot is a well-known example, often organizing other pixies into the Za-Lord's Guard.

creatures.Name: Cobbs
creatures.Description: Shoe-making fae known for their ritualistic 'shoe magic' and detailed craftsmanship.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron and distractions from their focused work.
creatures.Powers: Sole Binding (Prouesse): Can enchant footwear or bind motion via footwear. Ritual Magic.
creatures.Stats: Health: 4; Attack: 3; Defense: 5; Speed: 6 of Diamonds
creatures.Background: Usually non-violent, but can be coerced or bribed into faerie politics.

creatures.Name: Fetch: Bucky
creatures.Description: A murder-doll-sized creature with needle claws. Weakest of the Fetch forms.
creatures.Weakness: Very low durability, iron and fire.
creatures.Powers: Claw Surprise (Prouesse): +1 to initiative when jumping out of dark places.
creatures.Stats: Health: 5; Attack: 5; Defense: 4; Speed: 7 of Clubs
creatures.Background: One of the early-stage Fetch illusions used to terrify enemies.

creatures.Name: Fetch: Hammerhands
creatures.Description: Humanoid Fetch variant with enormous hammer-like fists and construction worker body.
creatures.Weakness: Slow speed, vulnerable to enchantment.
creatures.Powers: Smash Down (Prouesse): Weapon:4 fists. Hulking Size. Supernatural Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 12; Attack: 10; Defense: 7; Speed: 6 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Used to breach and bash. Heavy enforcer style Fetch creature.

creatures.Name: Fetch: The Reaper
creatures.Description: A monstrous, slasher-style juggernaut Fetch with brute force and horror intimidation.
creatures.Weakness: Vulnerable to direct counterspells and banishment.
creatures.Powers: Slasher Icon (Prouesse): Gains +2 attack when chasing a fleeing target. Weapon:5 melee.
creatures.Stats: Health: 14; Attack: 11; Defense: 9; Speed: Jack of Spades
creatures.Background: Shaped to invoke mortal fears of supernatural slashers. Capable of breaking wards.

creatures.Name: Fetch: The Scarecrow
creatures.Description: A towering, pumpkin-headed creature designed to inspire terror. One of the most dangerous Fetches.
creatures.Weakness: Divine light and direct truth magic.
creatures.Powers: Harvest Horror (Prouesse): Induces fear. Weapon:6 claw or scythe attacks. Supernatural Speed and Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 16; Attack: 13; Defense: 10; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: One of the final-stage Fetch illusions. Can devour hope and willpower.

creatures.Name: Ogre
creatures.Description: Massive fae creature with incredible physical resistance and brutality.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron, lacks finesse or tactical thinking.
creatures.Powers: Crushing Blow (Prouesse): Weapon:6 melee. Physical Immunity to mundane weapons. Supernatural Strength.
creatures.Stats: Health: 18; Attack: 12; Defense: 10; Speed: 5 of Clubs
creatures.Background: Commonly employed by the Winter Court for brute-force combat. Difficult to reason with.

creatures.Name: Elves
creatures.Description: Slender and fast fae warriors, often serving the Summer Court as scouts or snipers.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron. Over-reliance on agility.
creatures.Powers: Fae Archery (Prouesse): +2 to ranged attacks. Glamours. Inhuman Speed.
creatures.Stats: Health: 7; Attack: 9; Defense: 7; Speed: 10 of Spades
creatures.Background: Often appear during Summer-Winter clashes, or as part of formal fae armies.

creatures.Name: Lesser Dragon
creatures.Description: A smaller cousin to Ferrovax. Still capable of flight, breath weapons, and ancient magic.
creatures.Weakness: Vulnerabilities may include silver, ancient rites, or name-based bindings.
creatures.Powers: Dragon’s Breath (Prouesse): Weapon:6 fire or acid. Mythic Strength, Supernatural Recovery.
creatures.Stats: Health: Very High; Attack: Great; Defense: Great; Speed: King of Spades
creatures.Background: Rarely seen outside major events. May be couriers, messengers, or scouts for greater wyrms.

creatures.Name: The Wild Hunt
creatures.Description: A mythic ride of fae knights, beasts, and spirits. Terrifying and unstoppable when summoned.
creatures.Weakness: May be held back by oaths, riddles, or fae traditions. Disperses after mission.
creatures.Powers: Huntbound Charge (Prouesse): Zone-wide Weapon:4 charge; Mythic Speed, Pack Instincts.
creatures.Stats: Health: Group (oooooo); Attack: Legendary; Defense: Epic; Speed: Ace of Spades
creatures.Background: Seen in major war events. May be called by Wild Faerie Queens or invoked in treaties.

creatures.Name: The Walker
creatures.Description: One of the mysterious 'Walkers' — cousins to He Who Walks Behind, but even more elusive.
creatures.Weakness: Unclear. Ritual magic, true names, or reality anchors may resist them.
creatures.Powers: Mind Shear (Prouesse): Bypasses normal defense with sanity loss. Physical Immunity. Shadowslip.
creatures.Stats: Health: Very High; Attack: Epic; Defense: Legendary; Speed: Queen of Spades
creatures.Background: Their presence alters reality. Only powerful wizards survive encounters with them.

creatures.Name: Faerie Queen - Mab
creatures.Description: Queen of the Winter Court. An ancient, nearly divine entity wielding terrifying magical power.
creatures.Weakness: Bound by oaths and Faerie Law. May be thwarted by exact wording or inviolable hospitality.
creatures.Powers: Fae Sovereignty (Prouesse): +3 to all magic within Winter. Reality Manipulation, Mythic Abilities.
creatures.Stats: Health: Unknown (∞); Attack: Mythic; Defense: Mythic; Speed: Ace of Spades
creatures.Background: Manipulative, powerful, and ruthless. The epitome of Winter’s cold logic and wrath.

Description.text: The mortal agent and war-champion of the Summer Court, gifted with fae power and responsibility.

Weakness.text: Bound to Titania’s commands. Vulnerable to iron and fae contracts.

Powers.text: Knight’s Mantle (Prouesse): +2 to attack and defense while acting on Summer's will. Court Magic, Inhuman Traits.

Stats.text: Health: 10–12; Attack: 9–11; Defense: 9; Speed: Queen of Hearts

Background.text: Current or former champions of Summer such as Fix wield massive influence and combat power.

creatures.Name: Summer Gruff
creatures.Description: The middle-tier warriors of the Summer Court. Strong, fast, and tactically disciplined.
creatures.Weakness: Cold iron and strict honor code.
creatures.Powers: Hoof Stomp (Prouesse): +2 when charging. Inhuman Strength, Speed, Recovery.
creatures.Stats: Health: 10; Attack: 8; Defense: 8; Speed: 8 of Hearts
creatures.Background: Deployed to handle threats beneath Elder Gruff’s purview. Some are brothers or cousins to him.

creatures.Name: Summer Pixie Swarm
creatures.Description: Dozens of organized pixies attacking in formation under the Za-Lord's banner or Summer orders.
creatures.Weakness: Individually weak, iron, scattered by wind magic or intense sound.
creatures.Powers: Swarm Tactics (Prouesse): +1 per 2 in group. Glamours, Flight, Echoes of the Beast.
creatures.Stats: Health: Collective (oooo); Attack: Good; Defense: Fair; Speed: 9 of Hearts
creatures.Background: Effective distraction and harassment units, especially in urban warfare.

creatures.Name: Faerie Queen - Titania
creatures.Description: Queen of the Summer Court. A radiant force of nature, beauty, and wild power.
creatures.Weakness: Bound to Summer's oaths. Conflicted with Winter laws; must maintain Court balance.
creatures.Powers: Solar Sovereignty (Prouesse): +3 to nature-based magic. Mythic Presence, Life Manipulation.
creatures.Stats: Health: Unknown (∞); Attack: Mythic; Defense: Mythic; Speed: Ace of Hearts
creatures.Background: Embodying nature's generosity and wrath, Titania tempers the Wild Hunt with life’s protection.
